body.p:
Carlisle Oct. 8. 1864
To His Excellency T. E. Bramblet Gov. of Ky,

Your Petitioner John Delaney says he was lately tried in the Nicholas Circuit Court to wit, at its last September Term for stabbing John Barnett in a sudden heat of passion -- and was fined the sum of $50.
He says the proof was that Barnett had threatened to shoot him which was the Cause of the stabbing -- The stabbing was done with a pocket knife & did not inflict a Very serious wound --

Your Petitioner would state that he is subject to fits which he is satisfied affects his mind & Causes the least thing some times to throw him into excitement of an uncontrolable character & this & not the provocation he believes caused the cutting -- Barnett & himself were on good terms, but ^Barnett^ was made mad by your Petitioners hitting him in the face with a snow Ball -- He says he & his mother & another replevied the fine but he is poor & not able to pay it -- He therefore asks its remission & will ever pray &. --
We were jurors in Delaneys case above & we think the fine ought to be remitted

James Kennedy
Wm R Potts
J. P. Potts
S C Pepes
Edmund.. W.. Hardy
W H Waugh
W. K Fuller

John Delaney

Nicholas Cir Ct
